benchmark_details.name: TFHE-Coder (Fully Homomorphic Encryption Code Generation)
benchmark_details.overview: This work establishes the first benchmark for TFHE code generation, demonstrating how LLMs, when augmented with domain-specific feedback, can bridge the expertise gap in FHE code generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLM performance in generating TFHE code from natural language specifications.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The most challenging function remains the ReLU, with consistently low performance across all models.

data.source: Experiments conducted on TFHE code generation with various LLMs.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the proportion of generated code that compiles and executes correctly, as well as similarity to reference implementations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better compilability and functional correctness.
methodology.baseline_results: GPT-4o demonstrated the highest performance with near-perfect scores across tasks.
methodology.validation: Evaluation conducted using multiple mainstream LLMs under controlled experimental conditions.
